clinical_study.brief_title: Intravascular Injection Rates During Lumbar Medial Branch Block
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Intravascular Injection Rates During Cervical and Lumbar Medial Branch Block Using Touhy or Quincke Type Needle

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare using Toughy needle has an advantage of reducing the incidence of vasucular puncture during lumbar medial branch block.

detailed_description.textblock:
In previous reports, the use of Toughy needle was thought to reduce the incidence of intravascular injection during lumbar transforaminal injection. Blunt needles with a pencil point tip, such as Whitacre needles, are not as sharp at their tip as are Quincke needles, which have bevels. Toughy or blunt needles may therefore be less likely to penetrate a vessel during a procedure. Hence, the investigators postulated the incidence of intravenous uptake would be significantly lower using a Toughy needle than using a Quincke needle for lumbar medial branch block. To confirm the intravascular injection rates, the investigators used the real time fluoroscopy after injection of contrast medium.
The goal of this study was to compare the incidence of intravascular injection rate betweeen Toughy and Quincke needles using real time fluoroscopy during lumbar medial branch block

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 minute after finishing lumbar medial branch block
primary_outcome.description: incidence of intravascular injection during lumbar medial branch block

secondary_outcome.measure: time required to complete lumbar medial branch block
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 second after the completion of lumbar medial branch block
secondary_outcome.description: time required to complete lumbar medial branch block

secondary_outcome.measure: radiation amout to complete lumbar medial branch block
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 second after the completion of lumbar medial branch block
secondary_outcome.description: radiation amout to complete lumbar medial branch block

arm_group.description: medial branch block with touhy needle
medial branch block with Quincke needle

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- facet joint arthropathy
Exclusion Criteria:
- allergy to local anesthetics or contrast medium
- pregnancy
- spine deformity
- neurologic abnormality
